channel.title: linux on Samarth's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Samarth's Blog

item.title: Remote Linux Process Hacking through SSH
item.description: There’s this really cool process hacking series on YouTube by Keist Zenon. He uses the programming language Common Lisp to interact with processes on his Linux machine. I tried following the tutorial on my Mac, but macOS does not have the same ptrace commands and system call interfaces as Linux so this did not work out. However, I have VirtualBox set up on my Mac with a Debian VM which I use whenever I need Linux.
